alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 2:42AM CST until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Dallas. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Carrollton, Richardson, Coppell, Farmers Branch, University Park, Sachse, Addison, Highland Park, Dallas Love Field, DFW Intl Airport and Buckingham.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
